adjective.definition: Existing in thought or as an idea but not having a physical or concrete existence
adjective.example: He had an abstract idea of what happiness meant.

noun.definition: A summary of the contents of a book, article, or speech
noun.example: The paper included an abstract at the beginning.

verb.definition: To consider something theoretically or separately from something else
verb.example: She abstracted the key points from the report.

usage_examples: His paintings are abstract and open to interpretation.
